name: surface_radioactivity_content_of_248Cm
description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Radioactivity" means the number of radioactive decays of a material per second. "Cm" means the element "curium" and "248Cm" is the isotope "curium-248" with a half-life of 1.72e+08 days.
